Entries.default:
You are greeted by a tall, carefully composed man. The crescent moon in the center of his forehead glows faintly.

Up close, the careful tailoring of his opal-adorned robes and their immaculate cleanliness speak to a deep well of vanity.
"My friend, you return. If you require anything at all, you need only ask." The corners of his eyes crinkle with genuine delight.
"What can I do for you?"
"What do you have for sale?"
"Farewell."
"Welcome, welcome. I am Ganor, owner and proprietor of the Luminous Bathhouse."
"Do you know a boy named Degnos?"

"Casità Avetta's servant? The irritating one? Yes, he was here attending her just a few days ago."

Ganor waves his hand dismissively and rolls his eyes.
"Welcome, I am Ganor, owner and proprietor of the Luminous Bathhouse."

"Welcome, I am Ganor, owner and proprietor of the Luminous Bathhouse."

He stares at you for a moment, evaluating you, and purses his lips.
"How about you and your staff head on upstairs?"
"What? I'll do no such thing, not without a very compelling reason otherwise." Ganor balks, taken aback.
"You owe me a favor, remember?"
[Bribe him.] "Might five thousand copper change your mind?"
"I suppose. Come, let's see about that meeting." Ganor huffs, looking away.
"I must speak with Quarno and Töla privately."

"For that I must call all my staff away so you can get up to Ondra-knows-what kind of mischief? I think not."

He snorts derisively and gestures toward the stairs on the other side of the bath.
"Come, let's see about that meeting."
"Take your questions to my steward."
"Look at this mess! Please, leave. I must clean this up at once."
"I know you're responsible for this disaster, even if I can't prove it. Get out!"
"Ondra's tears, what now?!"
"Everyone upstairs! Now!"
"Look at this mess you've left me!"

"Now that they're in control, the Royal Deadfire Company refuses to honor my agreement with the mill."

He rubs a hands across his eyes and sighs heavily. He skin is dull, his eyes glassy with weariness.

"My friend, you return. If you require anything at all, you need only ask."

His small smile is tight with suspicion as he bows shallowly.
"That's a shame."
"I doubt it'll be missed."
[Shrug.] "Perhaps it's for the best."
"Would you believe that if it were your livelihood on the line? I sincerely doubt it." He scoffs at you and turns away.

"Yes. It is."

He speaks slowly, as if each word weighs heavily on his tongue.
"I'm looking for Brizze."
"They raised the price of adra again last week. At this rate, I'll be forced to close the bathhouse!"

"All I've worked for, and for what? How much can it really be worth if it can be undone by one sniper's bullet?"

He turns away from you with a snarl.
"I'd like to try your bath."
"Of course you would! Just speak with the steward near the stairs. He will make certain you are treated well."
"He tried to sneak into one of my rooms, then told me a pathetic sob story when he was caught."
"Mind where you stand lest you set the linens aflame. They will cost you a pretty copper to replace."
"You are the first of Magran's children to visit my establishment." He stares for a moment at your flaming head, pursing his lips.
"My guards will not hesitate to expel any rowdy or obnoxious individuals. Mind your manners, and you will find no quarrel with me."
"We have several rooms available for rent should you wish to 'speak' with them there."

"Oh! Well... why didn't you say so?"

He cheerfully pockets the money, patting it reassuringly where it rests on his hip.

"That's marvelous! Count yourself lucky, [Player Name], for now Ganor owes you a debt."

He claps you on the shoulder and grins widely.

"As evidence of my gratitude, you may soak in the baths at no cost today. And take, ah... these."

He dumps a pair of dirty boots in your hands.

"If there's any way I might make your visit more comfortable, you need only ask."

He clasps his hands and bows, a playful smile tugging at the corners of his lips.
"I had the guards toss him out on the street." He smiles, well-satisfied with himself.
"The veranda on the second floor is also lovely at this time of day."
"Pardon me?" Ganor looks at you askance, confused.
"Maybe you'd like to hold a staff meeting."
"I need to take care of something, and I can't have prying eyes watching."
"Let's get you some privacy, shall we?"
"Ugh, I suppose." Ganor huffs, looking away.
"That's outrageous!"

"Your exchange with Amreo was... observed. Such behavior is my responsibility.

"I have tripled his rates until he learns to conduct himself."

Ganor inclines his head.
"Ah, the new attendant? I believe she's cleaning one of the rooms upstairs."
